conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be traced to predict whether it flows into container D or E.
The image shows three inlets at the top labeled A (cyan), B (yellow), and C (blue), slanted baffles of various colors, and two containers at the bottom labeled D (orange, left) and E (green, right).
Each colored inlet at the top starts a stream of liquid that falls under gravity.
The slanted baffles deflect the liquid sideways, and at every impact, the stream follows the downward-sloping face of the baffle.
Tracing the path of each color shows where it emerges at the bottom collection gutters that lead either to container D or container E.
Liquid from A (cyan) is deflected left twice by the baffles and arrives above the left-hand outlet, flowing into container D.
Liquid from B (yellow) follows a central course and is guided left by the middle yellow baffle, reaching the left-hand outlet and flowing into container D.
Liquid from C (blue) remains toward the right after two right-sloping baffles, reaches the right-hand outlet, and flows into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A will end up in container D, liquid from B will end up in container D, and liquid from C will end up in container E.
